solution_line_template: Since there are {minutes_per_hour} minutes in {hours_walked_per_day} hour, then Lisa walks for {hours_walked_per_day} x {minutes_per_hour} = <<{minutes_per_hour}={minutes_walked_per_day}>>{minutes_walked_per_day} minutes every day.

For {minutes_walked_per_day} minutes, Lisa walks {minutes_walked_per_day} x {meters_per_minute} = <<{minutes_walked_per_day}*{meters_per_minute}={meters_walked_per_day}>>{meters_walked_per_day} meters.
Thus, she walks for {meters_walked_per_day} x {num_days} = <<{meters_walked_per_day}*{num_days}={total_meters_walked}>>{total_meters_walked} meters in two days.
